programme.title: Monday Night Football
programme.sub-title: Tampa Bay Buccaneers at Houston Texans
programme.desc: Tampa Bay Buccaneers (1-0) at Houston Texans (0-1). From NRG Stadium. Texas native Baker Mayfield steers the Bucs into town looking for their first win over Houston since 2003, the Texans' second NFL season. Vita Vea and Haason Reddick lead the pursuit of QB CJ Stroud, who was sacked three times in a 14-9 Week 1 loss at the Rams after going down 63 times (including playoffs) last season.

programme.title: Monday Night Football
programme.sub-title: Los Angeles Chargers at Las Vegas Raiders
programme.desc: Los Angeles Chargers (1-0) at Las Vegas Raiders (1-0). From Allegiant Stadium. Rookie RB Ashton Jeanty and the Silver & Black stand in the way as L.A. bids for its fifth straight AFC West win after knocking off the Chiefs in Week 1. Jim Harbaugh also renews his rivalry with new Raiders coach Pete Carroll, a history most known for a monumental upset of Carroll's USC by Harbaugh's Stanford in 2007.

programme.desc: They were arguably the most dominating defensive team in NFL history ? and perhaps the most entertaining club that pro football has ever seen. programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Chronicling the life and career of Hall of Fame defensive lineman and ordained minister Reggie White, told in part through never-before-seen footage from a 2004 interview filmed two months before his death. Directed by Ken Rodgers and Courtland Bragg.

programme.sub-title: Second Wind: The Boomer and Gunnar Esiason Story
programme.desc: An updated look at Boomer Esiason and his son Gunnar, and the family's journey in the fight against cystic fibrosis. programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: This three-part film begins as a modern cultural history of Italy, in particular the northern city of Milan, which in the early 1980s rose as a worldwide capital of fashion and commerce. At the center of that success was Silvio Berlusconi, a real estate magnate who entered the media sphere by buying local TV stations, then purchased his hometown football club, and set out to elevate it into the greatest professional team in the world.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: A new era of glory for A.C. Milan began with former player Fabio Capello taking the reins of the team and winning three consecutive Serie A titles from 1992 to 1994. As for the club's owner, when a political corruption scandal threatens to enmesh Berlusconi, he responds by running for the prime minister. The most powerful and successful man in Italian football is now the most powerful man in Italy--and yet the halo will only last so long.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Berlusconi evades more corruption allegations and trials and seems to be revived by another Scudetto for A.C. Milan in 1996. More and more, the line between football and politics is blurred, the cult of personality around the man grows even bigger, and even the most passionate A.C. Milan supporters start to struggle with the contradictions. There will be two more stints as prime minister, the controversy and turmoil seeming to grow with every year.

programme.title: NFL's Greatest Games
programme.sub-title: 2025: Los Angeles Rams at Philadelphia Eagles
programme.desc: From 2025: Los Angeles Rams at Philadelphia Eagles in an NFC Divisional Round game. The NFC champs from 2021 and 2022 collide just two steps away from another Super Bowl berth, with Sean McVay's Rams sending an improving defense led by Jared Verse against the potent Philly run game orchestrated by Jalen Hurts and anchored by Saquon Barkley. The Eagles had topped L.A. 37-20 on Nov. 24 as Barkley compiled 302 total yards from scrimmage and Matthew Stafford was sacked five times.

programme.title: Stanley Cup Final
programme.sub-title: Game 4: Edmonton Oilers at Florida Panthers
programme.desc: Edmonton Oilers at Florida Panthers in Game 4 of the NHL championship series. From Amerant Bank Arena. Paul Maurice's Panthers are halfway to repeating as Cup champions after dominating Edmonton 6-1 in Game 3, with Sam Bennett and Brad Marchand both scoring their fourth goals of the series. Sergei Bobrovsky stopped 32 shots by the Oilers, who fell to 1-4 in the Sunshine State in Cup Final games. Edmonton star Leon Draisaitl was held without a shot on goal, while teammate Evan Bouchard had nine.

programme.title: Stanley Cup Final
programme.sub-title: Game 5: Florida Panthers at Edmonton Oilers
programme.desc: Florida Panthers at Edmonton Oilers in Game 5 of the NHL championship series. From Rogers Place. This scintillating best-of-seven skates back to Canada tied 2-2 after Oilers goalie Calvin Pickard (7-0 this postseason) stopped 22 of 23 Florida shots in relief in Game 4, allowing Leon Draisaitl to deposit his NHL-record fourth overtime goal of the postseason for a 5-4 victory.

programme.title: Stanley Cup Final
programme.sub-title: Game 6: Edmonton Oilers at Florida Panthers
programme.desc: Edmonton Oilers at Florida Panthers in Game 6 of the NHL championship series. From Amerant Bank Arena. Up 3-2, the Panthers are one win away from repeating as Cup champions and bringing the Sunshine State its fourth NHL title in six years. Florida foiled the Oilers 5-2 in Game 5 behind hot scorers Brad Marchand and Sam Bennett, and have an 8-0 edge in first-period scoring the last three games.

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: From 1982: Philadelphia at Los Angeles Lakers in Game 6 of the NBA Finals. The Lakers took the title with a 114-104 victory.

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: From 1983: Philadelphia at Los Angeles Lakers in Game 4 of the Finals. The 76ers won 115-108 to sweep the series. Moses Malone led Philadelphia with 24 points, while Kareem Abdul-Jabbar had 28 for the Lakers.

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: From 1983: Detroit at Denver. The Pistons beat Denver 186-184 in triple overtime in the highest-scoring game in NBA history. Isiah Thomas scored a career-high 47 points for Detroit.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 4: Los Angeles Lakers at Minnesota Timberwolves
programme.desc: Los Angeles Lakers at Minnesota Timberwolves in Game 4 of a Western Conference first-round series. From Target Center. Chris Finch's T-Wolves have a 2-1 series edge after a spirited 13-1 closing run to take Game 3, 116-104. Fifth-year forward Jaden McDaniels scored a career playoff-high 30 points and helped clamp down on L.A.'s Luka Doncic. LeBron James tallied 38 in a losing effort.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 4: Oklahoma City Thunder at Memphis Grizzlies
programme.desc: Oklahoma City Thunder at Memphis Grizzlies in Game 4 of a Western Conference first-round series. From FedExForum. Top-seeded OKC survived a 29-point deficit in Game 3 en route to a 114-108 victory and a 3-0 series lead. Shai Gilgeous-Alexander scored 31 and Jalen Williams added 26, including the go-ahead free throw that game the Thunder their first lead with 1:20 to play. Scottie Pippen tallied 28 in defeat.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 1: Indiana Pacers at Cleveland Cavaliers
programme.desc: Indiana Pacers at Cleveland Cavaliers in Game 1 of an Eastern Conference semifinal series. From Rocket Arena. Kenny Atkinson's top-seeded Cavs get back to action after sweeping their first-round series by an average of 30.5 points, with star guard Donovan Mitchell sharing the spotlight with Indiana's Tyrese Haliburton. Cleveland took the teams' last two playoff meetings in 2017 and 2018 (1st Rd.).

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 2: Indiana Pacers at Cleveland Cavaliers
programme.desc: Indiana Pacers at Cleveland Cavaliers in Game 2 of an Eastern Conference semifinal series. From Rocket Arena. Indy drew first blood against the top-seeded Cavs with a 121-112 triumph capped by a 15-4 run in which guards Tyrese Haliburton (13 assists) and Andrew Nembhard (23 points) took over. Donovan Mitchell's record-setting eighth straight Game 1 with 30-plus points went for naught for Cleveland, which allowed the Pacers to shoot 19-for-36 on threes.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 5: Indiana Pacers at Cleveland Cavaliers
programme.desc: Indiana Pacers at Cleveland Cavaliers in Game 5 of an Eastern Conference semifinal series. From Rocket Arena. The top-seeded Cavs have their backs to the wall, down 3-1, with star guard Donovan Mitchell nursing an ankle injury after a blowout loss to Indiana in Game 4. Pacers big men Myles Turner and Pascal Siakam were 16-for-23 in the win, combining for 41 points in just 43 total minutes played.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 1: New York Knicks at Boston Celtics
programme.desc: New York Knicks at Boston Celtics in Game 1 of an Eastern Conference semifinal series. From TD Garden. The 15th all-time playoff series between these division foes (7-7) is the first since 2013, with reigning-champion Boston having swept all four regular-season clashes with the Knicks. Jayson Tatum (31.2 ppg) and Jalen Brunson (31.5) set scorching scoring paces in the first round of the playoffs.

programme.title: Shaqtin' A Fool
programme.desc: The worst plays from the 1980s, 1990s and 2000s are spotlighted in a "retro" edition of Shaquille O'Neal's blooper show. Magic Johnson, Larry Bird, Charles Barkley and even Michael Jordan are among the NBA legends featured.

programme.title: Shaqtin' A Fool
programme.desc: Shaq and crew hand out the not-so-coveted Shaqtin Trophy to the worst blooper offenders of early 2014-15. Awards categories include "Worst Pass," "Worst Shot," "Worst Play by an All-Star," and a "Lifetime Achievement Award.".

programme.title: Shaqtin' A Fool
programme.desc: Celebrating the show's first four seasons with Shaquille O'Neal, Dennis Scott and Jared Greenberg, counting down the most foolish and memorable moments. Plus, the 2014-15 Shaqtin MVP candidates are unveiled.

programme.title: Shaqtin' A Fool
programme.desc: Shaquille O'Neal counts down the show's top moments from this season and unveils his 2015-16 Shaqtin' MVP.

programme.title: Shaqtin' A Fool
programme.desc: The first game show in Shaqtin' A Fool history tests Shaq's show knowledge as he matches wits with co-host Dennis Scott and special guest Tony Rock. The game show features 10 categories of foolishness, and countless laughs.

programme.title: Shaqtin' A Fool
programme.desc: Shaquille O'Neal highlights outrageous NBA moments from players, fans, mascots, and coaches, as well as humorous bloopers from prior seasons and his own career.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.sub-title: 2025: Los Angeles Lakers at Chicago Bulls
programme.desc: 2025: Los Angeles Lakers at Chicago Bulls.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 2: New York Knicks at Boston Celtics
programme.desc: New York Knicks at Boston Celtics in Game 2 of an Eastern Conference semifinal series. From TD Garden. Tom Thibodeau's Knicks try to maintain the momentum of a gritty 108-105 overtime win in the opener in which they trailed Boston by 20 in the second half. OG Anunoby and Jalen Brunson scored a game-high 29 in the win, which snapped a nine-game home playoff win streak for the Celtics dating back to Game 2 of last spring's second round vs. Cleveland.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 4: Boston Celtics at New York Knicks
programme.desc: Boston Celtics at New York Knicks in Game 4 of an Eastern Conference semifinal series. From Madison Square Garden. New York's series lead is down to 2-1 after a 115-93 loss in Game 3 that drops the Knicks to 1-3 at home this postseason. Boston led wire-to-wire and shot a sizzling 50 percent from beyond the arc, with all five starters sinking a three, plus five from Payton Pritchard (23 points).

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 5: New York Knicks at Boston Celtics
programme.desc: New York Knicks at Boston Celtics in Game 5 of an Eastern Conference semifinal series. From TD Garden. The Knicks are one win away from their first conference final in a quarter century after fending off Boston 121-113 in Game 4 behind Jalen Brunson's 39 points and 12 assists. Celtics star Jayson Tatum left with a leg injury in the final minutes after pouring in 42 points.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 6: Boston Celtics at New York Knicks
programme.desc: Boston Celtics at New York Knicks in Game 6 of an Eastern Conference semifinal series. From Madison Square Garden. Down 3-2, reigning-champion Boston won't go quietly despite losing star forward Jayson Tatum to injury. Jaylen Brown, Derrick White (60 points combined) and reserve center Luke Kornet starred in a 127-102 Game 5 win, delaying New York's bid for its first Eastern final in 25 years.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 2: New York Knicks at Boston Celtics
programme.desc: New York Knicks at Boston Celtics in Game 2 of an Eastern Conference semifinal series. From TD Garden. Tom Thibodeau's Knicks try to maintain the momentum of a gritty 108-105 overtime win in the opener in which they trailed Boston by 20 in the second half. OG Anunoby and Jalen Brunson scored a game-high 29 in the win, which snapped a nine-game home playoff win streak for the Celtics dating back to Game 2 of last spring's second round vs. Cleveland.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 2: Denver Nuggets at Oklahoma City Thunder
programme.desc: Denver Nuggets at Oklahoma City Thunder in Game 2 of a Western Conference semifinal series. From Paycom Center. Top-seeded OKC tries to bounce back from a demoralizing 121-119 loss to the Nuggets in Game 1, which the Thunder led for the entire second half until Aaron Gordon's three in the final seconds. Nikola Jokic amassed team-highs of 42 points, 22 boards, six assists and seven turnovers.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 3: Boston Celtics at Orlando Magic
programme.desc: Boston Celtics at Orlando Magic in Game 3 of an Eastern Conference first-round series. NBA-champion Boston is up 2-0 as action shifts south to the Magic City, where the C's have lost on their last four regular-season visits. Jaylen Brown's 36 points, 10 boards and five assists keyed a 109-100 win in Game 2 with sidekick Jayson Tatum sidelined (wrist). Orlando's Paolo Banchero scored 32 in defeat.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 4: Boston Celtics at Orlando Magic
programme.desc: Boston Celtics at Orlando Magic in Game 4 of an Eastern Conference first-round series. From Kia Center. Boston's losing streak on the Magic's homecourt is at five after a 95-93 loss in Game 3 that cut the Celtics' series lead to 2-1. Jayson Tatum and Jaylen Brown combined for 55 points but also 13 of Boston's 21 turnovers. Franz Wagner's 32 points and eight assists led Orlando.

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: The landmark 1976 ABA and 1984 NBA slam dunk contests, both in Denver. Julius Erving and Larry Nance prevailed in the first-ever dunk contests for these pro leagues.

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: The 1972 NBA All-Star game. Jerry West hit a last-second jumper to give the West a 112-110 win.

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.sub-title: 1976: Denver Nuggets at New York Nets
programme.desc: From 1976: Denver Nuggets at New York Nets in Game 6 of the last ABA Finals. League and playoffs MVP Julius Erving led the Nets against fellow high-flyer David Thompson and the Nuggets.

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.sub-title: 2015: Cleveland Cavaliers at Golden State Warriors
programme.desc: From 2015: Cleveland at Golden State in Game 1 of the NBA Finals.

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.sub-title: 2015: Cleveland Cavaliers at Golden State Warriors
programme.desc: From 2015: Cleveland at Golden State in Game 2 of the NBA Finals.

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: From 1986: Boston at Houston in Game 3 of the NBA Finals. Ralph Sampson and the Rockets turned back Boston 106-104 despite a triple-double by Larry Bird. Robert Reid and Hakeem Olajuwon also shined for Houston, which cut its series deficit to 2-1.

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: From 1986: Chicago at Boston in Game 2 of a first-round playoff series. Michael Jordan exploded for a playoff-record 63 points, but the Celtics pulled out a 135-131 win in double overtime.

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.sub-title: 1985: Los Angeles Lakers at Boston Celtics
programme.desc: From 1985: Los Angeles Lakers at Boston in Game 6 of the NBA Finals. The Lakers outscored Boston 111-100 to clinch their third title of the '80s. Kareem Abdul-Jabbar led L.A. with 29 points.

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: The landmark 1976 ABA and 1984 NBA slam dunk contests, both in Denver. Julius Erving and Larry Nance prevailed in the first-ever dunk contests for these pro leagues.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: 2025: Minnesota Timberwolves at Denver Nuggets.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 1: Golden State Warriors at Minnesota Timberwolves
programme.desc: Golden State Warriors at Minnesota Timberwolves in Game 1 of a Western Conference semifinal series. From Target Center. Chris Finch's T-Wolves enjoy homecourt to start just their third-ever conference semifinal, a round Steph Curry and Golden State have reached for the eighth time in 11 years. Former Minnesota guard Jimmy Butler (2017-19) adds experience to the Warrior lineup that went seven games in Round 1, while the T-Wolves dispatched the Lakers in five.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 3: Minnesota Timberwolves at Golden State Warriors
programme.desc: Minnesota Timberwolves at Golden State Warriors in Game 3 of a Western Conference semifinal series. From Chase Center. With the series tied 1-1, Anthony Edwards and the T-Wolves hit the road, where they are an impressive 8-3 in the postseason since last spring. Golden State was hamstrung by Steph Curry's absence in Game 2, falling 117-93, with 20 turnovers. Julius Randle's 24 points led Minnesota.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 4: Minnesota Timberwolves at Golden State Warriors
programme.desc: Minnesota Timberwolves at Golden State Warriors in Game 4 of a Western Conference semifinal series. From Chase Center. The T-Wolves have a 2-1 series edge and are a remarkable 9-3 on the road in the last two postseasons, after surging late in Game 3 in San Francisco for a 102-97 win. Julius Randle logged a triple double, while Anthony Edwards scored a game-high 36.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 5: Golden State Warriors at Minnesota Timberwolves
programme.desc: Golden State Warriors at Minnesota Timberwolves in Game 5 of a Western Conference semifinal series. From Target Center. Anthony Edwards and the T-Wolves are up 3-1 on Golden State, who've lost three in a row for the first time since December as Steph Curry sits with a hamstring injury. Julius Randle joined Edwards with 30-plus points in Game 4, the first T-Wolves playoff duo to do that since 2004 (Kevin Garnett and Sam Cassell).

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 2: Milwaukee Bucks at Indiana Pacers
programme.desc: Milwaukee Bucks at Indiana Pacers in Game 2 of an Eastern Conference first-round series. From Gainbridge Fieldhouse. Indy raced to a 1-0 series lead with a 117-98 win three days ago, fueled by Pascal Siakam's 25 points. Giannis Antetokounmpo (36 points) was just 8-for-15 on free throws for Milwaukee, which led the league in three-point percentage but was 9-for-37 in Game 1.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 3: Indiana Pacers at Milwaukee Bucks
programme.desc: Indiana Pacers at Milwaukee Bucks in Game 3 of an Eastern Conference first-round series. From Fiserv Forum. Doc Rivers' Bucks have work to do down 2-0 in this rematch from last year's first round, with six of the eight total meetings between the teams decided by double-digits. Indy never trailed in a 123-115 Game 2 win, sinking all 19 of its free throws as both sides shot well throughout.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 5: Milwaukee Bucks at Indiana Pacers
programme.desc: Milwaukee Bucks at Indiana Pacers in Game 5 of an Eastern Conference first-round series. From Gainbridge Fieldhouse. Indiana is a win away from its second straight first-round dispatching of the Bucks after scorching the nets with 60.2 percent shooting in a 129-103 Game 4 triumph. Myles Turner had 23 points (and four blocks) to lead eight double-figure scorers for the Pacers, who sank 18 threes.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 1: Detroit Pistons at New York Knicks
programme.desc: Detroit Pistons at New York Knicks in Game 1 of an Eastern Conference first-round series. From Madison Square Garden. Fourth-year star Cade Cunningham heads the Pistons' first playoff squad in six years, and averaged 30.8 points and 8.3 assists vs. New York this season as Detroit went 2-0 at MSG. Jalen Brunson and Karl-Anthony Towns pace the Knicks in the teams' first playoff meeting since 1992.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Memphis Grizzlies at Miami Heat. From Thu. April 3, 2025.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 1: Denver Nuggets at Oklahoma City Thunder
programme.desc: Denver Nuggets at Oklahoma City Thunder in Game 1 of a Western Conference semifinal series. From Paycom Center. The top-seeded Thunder return to action after eight off days, facing interim coach David Adelman's Nuggets, who are fresh off winning a seven-game slugfest vs. the Clippers. MVP candidates Nikola Jokic and Shai Gilgeous-Alexander star in the teams first playoff meeting since 2011, when OKC got its first postseason series win since moving from Seattle.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 3: Oklahoma City Thunder at Denver Nuggets
programme.desc: Oklahoma City Thunder at Denver Nuggets in Game 3 of a Western Conference semifinal series. From Ball Arena. The series is knotted at 1-1 as top-seeded OKC rolls into the Mile High City for the first time since early November, following a resounding 149-106 win in Game 2. Shai Gilgeous-Alexander tallied 34 points in just 30 minutes, with his team scoring an NBA playoff record 87 first-half points.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 4: Oklahoma City Thunder at Denver Nuggets
programme.desc: Oklahoma City Thunder at Denver Nuggets in Game 4 of a Western Conference semifinal series. From Ball Arena. A battle-tested Nuggets squad won Game 3 in overtime to take a 2-1 series lead on green, top-seeded OKC. Jamal Murray (27 pts., 4 steals) and Aaron Gordon sparked Denver while big man Nikola Jokic struggled (0-for-10 on threes, 8 turnovers). Jalen Williams' 32 points paced the Thunder.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 5: Denver Nuggets at Oklahoma City Thunder
programme.desc: Denver Nuggets at Oklahoma City Thunder in Game 5 of a Western Conference semifinal series. From Paycom Center. Mark Daigneault's Thunder return home tied 2-2 as they've disrupted Denver big man Nikola Jokic into more turnovers (23) than assists (22) through four games. Shai Gilgeous-Alexander had nine of his 25 points late in a 92-87 Game 4 win, in which OKC also had a 35-8 edge in bench scoring.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 2: Detroit Pistons at New York Knicks
programme.desc: Detroit Pistons at New York Knicks in Game 2 of an Eastern Conference first-round series. From Madison Square Garden. The Pistons try again to end their 15-game playoff losing streak after falling 123-112 in Game 1 in the Big Apple, crumbling by 40-21 in the fourth quarter. Jalen Brunson's 34 led New York, while Karl-Anthony Towns and OG Anunoby combined for nine steals, four blocks and 46 points.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 3: New York Knicks at Detroit Pistons
programme.desc: New York Knicks at Detroit Pistons in Game 3 of an Eastern Conference first-round series. From Little Caesars Arena. J.B. Bickerstaff's Pistons return to the Motor City as playoff winners for the first time in 17 years following a 100-94 triumph in Game 2 that knotted the series at 1-1. Cade Cunningham piled up 33 points and 12 boards in the win, while Jalen Brunson's 37 went for naught.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 4: New York Knicks at Detroit Pistons
programme.desc: New York Knicks at Detroit Pistons in Game 4 of an Eastern Conference first-round series. From Little Caesars Arena. J.B. Bickerstaff's Pistons trail 2-1 in the series and are a loss away from matching the league record of nine for consecutive home playoff losses, set by the 76ers (1968-71). Karl-Anthony Towns (31 points) and Jalen Brunson (30) carried New York in a 118-116 Game 3 victory.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 5: Detroit Pistons at New York Knicks
programme.desc: Detroit Pistons at New York Knicks in Game 5 of an Eastern Conference first-round series. From Madison Square Garden. Tom Thibodeau's Knicks pulled out two razor-thin wins in Motown to take a 3-1 series lead, as Cade Cunningham and Detroit look to punch back at MSG. Jalen Brunson (32 points, 11 assists) and Karl-Anthony Towns (27 points) led the way in Game 4, which also saw a last-second non-call go New York's way on a three-point shot by Tim Hardaway Jr.
